India is a land of many languages, our d: India is a land of many languages, our digital strategy must reflect it.
90% of India's population uses regional: 90% of India's population uses regional languages to conduct their day-to-day activities.
As more and more people use digital plat: As more and more people use digital platforms for financial, educational and social activities, digital platforms must work seamlessly in all Indian Languages.
This is where you come in.
Every minute of your contribution will m: Every minute of your contribution will make a huge difference and bring us closer to our objective.
EkStep Foundation gathers partners and c: EkStep Foundation gathers partners and creates open infrastructure, tools and frameworks to solve complex societal problems at scale. We do this by leveraging the open source digital infrastructure we have created called Sunbird and by following a way of thinking and doing called the Societal Platform Approach.
EkStep is a not-for-profit organization: EkStep is a not-for-profit organization founded by Rohini and Nandan Nilekani and Shankar Maruwada.

A Crowdsourcing initiative for Indian La: A Crowdsourcing initiative for Indian Languages
[Bhaashini] aims to create open datasets: [Bhaashini] aims to create open datasets to develop Speech Recognition, Text-to-Speech, Machine Translation and Optical Character Recognition for Indian languages. This initiative will empower our technologists, language enthusiasts and language communities to build world class digital applications in our own local languages.
This is an effort by MeitY, Government o: This is an effort by MeitY, Government of India, under the National Language Translation Mission (NLTM). This effort is supported by EkStep Foundation on a pro-bono basis and leverages its open source work under https://sunbird.org/projects/vakyansh along with various other open source frameworks.
We need to build speech recognition, tex: We need to build speech recognition, text-to-speech, machine translation and OCR technologies that are tuned for your language.
These technologies will transform your l: These technologies will transform your language to become "digital first" in various sectors such as: education, healthcare and media.
The tools, utilities and models proposed: The tools, utilities and models proposed to be developed in your language will rely on open source contributions through the Bhaashini crowd sourcing platform
The above mentioned technologies rely on: The above mentioned technologies rely on AI technology that requires large datasets in their respective fields.
[Bhaashini] currently has four crowdsouc: [Bhaashini] currently has four crowdsoucing initiatives to create these datasets
Bolo India creates a repository of diver: Bolo India creates a repository of diverse voices speaking Indian languages, where volunteer reads the corresponding text.
Suno India creates an open dataset throu: Suno India creates an open dataset through transcription of audio files.
Likho India creates open parallel transl: Likho India creates open parallel translation datasets between corresponding sentences in two languages.
Dekho India creates an open data reposit: Dekho India creates an open data repository of images and the corresponding text.
We are inviting you to join us and volun: We are inviting you to join us and voluntarily contribute to this initiative. Contributing at one stretch can be overwhelming hence you can do this by visiting the website multiple times and commence from where you left us off.
Enrich Indian languages become atma-nirb: Enrich Indian languages become atma-nirbhar through these datasets.
Enrich your language by donating your vo: Enrich your language by donating your voice
Enrich your language by transcribing aud: Enrich your language by transcribing audio into text
Enrich your language by translating text: Enrich your language by translating text
Enrich your language by labelling images: Enrich your language by labelling images
BhashaDaan: A crowdsourcing initiative f: BhashaDaan: A crowdsourcing initiative for Indian languages
Become a Bhasha Samarthak by contributin: Become a Bhasha Samarthak by contributing to Bolo India, Suno India, Likho India or Dekho India. Earn Bronze/Silver/Gold/Platinum Bhasha Samarthak Badges based on your contributions. Share them in your social circle, your language community, and motivate your friends and family to contribute to the cause.
Become a Bhasha Samarthak by contributing to these initiatives. For details on how to earn Bhasha Samarthak Badges, please select the initiative and language of your choice.
Levels and badges may take upto 48 hours: Levels and badges may take upto 48 hours to update. Your contribution will be validated before confirming the badge. Please keep contributing actively to stand a chance to get recognised.
Help to build an open repository of data: Help to build an open repository of data to digitally enrich your language

If you are the copyright holder of this: If you are the copyright holder of this data and believe it should not be used on the platform, please send us an email to optout@bhashini.gov.inCopy to clipboard with evidence that you are indeed the copyright holder of this data.
